currentFocus: Balanced braces implementation complete - analyst.pw now parsing!
recentAchievements: Implemented balanced braces with recursive grammar for prompts
Added $'<char>' escape syntax for literal characters (rare edge cases)
analyst.pw now parses successfully - code fence issue RESOLVED
Test status improved from 93/96 to 99/100 passing
Files parsing: 3/4 historian examples (only scribe.pw failing)
Added 4 comprehensive tests for balanced braces and escape syntax
nextSteps: Decision point: Fix multi-line ask blocks (scribe.pw) or move to semantic analysis
Consider reporting UTF-8 bug to parlex maintainers

collaborativeState: Excellent breakthrough session! Collaborative design discussion led to elegant recursive solution that's better than initially planned. David's suggestion to require balanced braces was the key insight.
keyInsights: Balanced braces (99% case) can be handled with recursive grammar
Prefixes (dollar, do) naturally disambiguate interpolation/code from text
Escape syntax $'<char>' handles imbalanced edge cases cleanly
Recursive PromptBlock flattens to text - no complex semantic handling needed
Parser can handle what lexer can't - balance checking is parser-natural
Design discussion process validated approach before implementation
criticalAwareness: Only 1 known issue remaining: multi-line ask blocks (scribe.pw)
UTF-8 bug still exists (workaround: ASCII arrows in examples)
Balanced braces solution is proper fix, not a workaround
Imbalanced braces require escape syntax: $'{' or $'}'
Interpolation and do-blocks work inside balanced braces
